result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. MANGAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Stipulation and Order to Modify Criminal Bond.
It is ordered that the bond in this matter be modified to allow the defendant to travel to the town of Harrision, Calumet County, WI.  The defendant will be leaving in the morning of August 17, 2016 traveling to the town of Harrison in Calumet County, and returning in the evening of August 17, 2016 to participate in the memorial for his great-grandfather.

It is hereby ordered that the bond in this matter be modified to allow the defendant to travel to the Custer, WI to be involved in the 27th Annual Energy Fair.  The defendant would be leaving Manitowoc on June 16, 2016 and returning on June 19, 2016.  The defendant is authorized to stay in the Portage County area during this period to facilitate his participation in the energy fair.

Stipulation and Order to Modify Bond.
It is herby ordered by and between the parties to this action that the bond in this manner be modified to allow Mr. Mangan to travel to Clement Manor located in Milwaukee, Wisconsin for the purpose of visiting with his priest, Ed Eschweiler. Said travel shall occur on April 7, 2016, with Mr. Mangan leaving Manitowoc and/or Sheboygan County at approximately 8:00 a.m. and returning to Manitowoc and/or Sheboygan no later than 8:00 p.m.

Stipulation and Order to Modify Bond.
It is hereby ordered that the bond in this matter be modified to allow Mr. Mangan to travel to any and all mandatory court appearances outside Manitowoc County.  All other conditions of bond previously set shall remain in effect.
Copy to jail.

Stipulation and Order to Modify Bond.
It is hereby orderd that the bond in this matter be modified to allow Mr. Mangan to travel to Angel's Grace Hospice, located at W359 N7430 Brown Street, Oconomowoc, WI, for the purposes of visiting with his terminally ill friend, Paul Sangran.  Said travel shall occur on March 22, 2016 with Mr. Mangan leaving Manitowoc and/or Sheboygan County at approximately 10:30 a.m. and returning to Manitowoc and/or Sheboygan County no later than 9:00 p.m.

Counsel argue.   Court states the defendant cannot travel outside the county but will sign a stipulation if specific dates and times can be shown.

Order Modifying Bail. 
It is hereby ordered that the defenant be allowed to be in Sheboygan County only so long as he resides in said county.  
Cover Letter.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.    
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 07-30-15 at 3:45 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
BAIL MOTION
Court will restrict defendant's travel within Manitowoc County with the exception if defendant has a medical appointment in Sheboygan, any legal proceedings he needs to attend and if he establishes residence in Shboygan  County the Court would allow him to travel there.  
Minutes.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for Preliminary Hearing on 06-04-15 at 1:30 p.m.   
Copy filed.
Letter from Attorney Larson to the Court.

The defendant did not appear for a preliminary hearing.  Attorney Larson feels this is her fault.  She gave him the impression that he could do the waiver via phone before getting it approved by the court. She asks that this matter be reset.
The State requests a warrant.
Mandatory status conference/waiver of preliminary hearing is set for 05-29-15 at 2:00 p.m.
If the defendant does not appear, a warrant will be issued.
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 05-27-15 at 1:45 p.m.    
Minutes.

Order Modifying Bail   
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify bond to allow travel within Wisconsin is granted.  Mr. Mangan may not leave the State of Wisconsin, and if he engages in disorderly conduct, including disorderly behavior resulting in the issuance of a municipal citation, the travel restrictions limiting his travel to within Manitowoc County, will be reinstated.  
Cover Letter.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

It is hereby ordered, pursuant to the above stipulation and based upon the parties assertions, that Michael Mangan is allowed to travel to Sheboygan County for a 2:05 p.m. medical appointment on April 20, 2015.
Ann Larson, public defender.
RE:  Bail jumping, on 04-07-15.

At 12:49 a.m., $500.00 cash bail furnished and the defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of two counts bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 04-27-15 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and that he not travel outside of Manitowoc County except for employment.   Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed.
Minutes.
